title: Hailey Bieber sends Selena Gomez some love as she 'likes' photo of the singer
text:
Looks like there really are no hard feelings between Hailey Bieber and Selena Gomez.

The pair's love rivalry was brought back to the forefront this week after Selena released new music widely believed to be about Justin Bieber, triggering an avalanche of social media drama.

But all of that looks like it's water under the bridge after Hailey, 22, went ahead and 'liked' a photo of Selena, 27, celebrating her new music.

No hard feelings: Hailey Bieber 'liked' a photo of Selena Gomez celebrating the release of her new music

The snap was posted by Selena's good friend Racquelle Stevens on Thursday, and sees the singer celebrating the release of her new music with her gal pals.

It has been quite the week for Selena and Hailey.

Selena released her new song, Lose You To Love Me, a few days ago, and it didn't take long for everyone to conclude the track was about her ex Justin, who is now married to Hailey.

Not long after the track was released, fans noticed Hailey posted a screenshot of the song I'll Kill You by Summer Walker, which many people interpreted as a response to Selena's new song.

Coincidence: Hailey insisted she was not responding to Gomez's new song when she posted a screenshot of the song I'll Kill You

Uh-oh: The pair's love rivalry was brought back to the forefront this week after Selena released a new track about Justin Bieber, triggering an avalanche of drama

However, Hailey insisted the screenshot was not a response.

Selena addressed the speculation on her own Instagram, telling fans: 'I am so grateful for the response this song is getting. However, I do not stand for women tearing women down. And I will never, ever be by that.'

Since releasing Lose You To Love Me, Selena debuted a second empowering song, Look At Her Now, which is also believed to be about Justin.

Be kind: Selena even asked fans via Instagram to stop tearing women down

The singer-actress is in awe of just how much progress she's made since first writing the music.

'From going from there to where I am now is the greatest feeling,' she said on On Air With Ryan Seacrest, suggesting she was happy to finally be over Justin once and for all.

Selena explained why she waited so long to release the songs.

Growth: The actress said it was the 'greatest feeling' knowing how much progress she had made since first writing the songs

'It's actually perfect timing because I was going to release it two years ago and none of the words that I'm speaking would have existed.

'So taking a moment to actually feel the feelings that I've gone through, it's just — I don't know — I'm just so grateful that it's out. It's weird too because I wrote this song over a year ago … and it's like I feel completely different from when I wrote it. ... It's such an interesting feeling.

'It's more beautiful for me because I know exactly where I was when I wrote it and how I felt.

'It would have been too hard to release it when it was written, now it's fun, I am smiling. It's all the feelings right? It's everything from happy to emotional to realizing it and being frustrated. I wanted to validate all those feelings.'

Man and wife: Justin and Hailey at their second wedding in South Carolina this year
description: The pair's love rivalry was brought back to the forefront this week after Selena released a new track about Justin Bieber, triggering an avalanche of drama.
